#Text=Wikinews interviews three figures from Donald Trump 's political past
#Text=Sunday , March 13 , 2016
#Text=Donald Trump in 2011 .
#Text=Image : Gage Skidmore .
#Text=Wikinews spoke with three people associated with the early political career of U.S. businessman Donald Trump , the front-runner for the Republican Party 's 2016 presidential nomination .

#Text=Those interviewed include longtime political operative Roger Stone , a close associate of Trump and director of Trump 's 2000 presidential exploratory committee ; journalist Dave Shiflett , co-writer of Trump 's 2000 campaign book The America We Deserve ; and political consultant Russ Verney , who served as chairman of the Reform Party of the United States of America which Trump briefly joined .

#Text=In Trump 's highly publicized 2016 campaign , he has run under the banner of Make America Great Again , advocating a Mexican -funded wall along the U.S. – Mexico border , renegotiation of trade terms with other nations , and a temporary halt on the immigration of Muslims to the United States .
#Text=He holds a considerable lead in Republican National Convention delegates over his opponents , winning 15 of the first 24 primary and caucus contests .
#Text=Though this is Trump 's most visible campaign , it is not his first foray into electoral politics .

#Text=He flirted with Republican presidential runs : first in 1987 , when he purchased newspaper advertisements on foreign policy and delivered a campaign-like speech in the first-in-the-nation primary state of New Hampshire ; and then in 2011 , when he briefly led nationwide opinion polls for the presidential nomination after questioning the citizenship of President Barack Obama .

#Text=Trump 's most extensive campaign before now came during the 2000 presidential election when he opened an exploratory committee to consider seeking the presidential nomination of the Reform Party .
#Text=For 2000 , Trump conducted various speeches and media appearances in support of his potential presidential campaign .
#Text=He placed Stone in charge of his exploratory committee and hired Shiflett to work on what would become The America We Deserve .

#Text=His chief opponent for the nomination was paleoconservative icon and eventual nominee Pat Buchanan who entered the race after ending his third unsuccessful campaign for the Republican presidential nomination .
#Text=Based on Buchanan 's comments against American involvement in World War II , Trump attacked Buchanan as a " Hitler lover " and anti-Semite .
#Text=Trump 's campaign received support from then- Minnesota governor Jesse Ventura , the highest ranking elected official in the Reform Party .
#Text=This placed Trump at odds with the faction of industrialist Ross Perot , the party 's founder and two time presidential candidate .
#Text=Verney , a Perot confidante , was chairman of the party during Trump 's exploration .
#Text=Though initially dismissive of the campaign , Verney eventually welcomed Trump into the race .
#Text=However , the deep divisions within the party precipitated the exit of Ventura , and Trump did not seek the nomination .
#Text=Despite leaving the race , Trump still appeared on Reform Party presidential primary ballots in California and Michigan , winning both states .
